oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photograph of Old Hickory from Riverside Drive, Facing the Village
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: To the far right of the picture is the dormitory that housed plant workers. One section of the building was for men, one for women, and the two were connected by a cafeteria and recreational hall and a porch. Riverside drive can be seen in the foreground at the left. In the distance are the larger two and three-story homes constructed for those persons higher up in management at the plant. Old Hickory was the home of the DuPont operated gunpowder plant during WWI. The facility included worker housing.
